1.verse: The word of ADONAI that came to Joel the son of Pethuel:

2.verse: Mourn the Land’s Destruction - Hear this, elders! Give ear, all inhabitants of the land. Has this ever happened in your days, or even in the days of your fathers?

3.verse: Tell your children about it— your children to their children, their children to another generation.

4.verse: What the locust left, the swarming locust has eaten, and what the swarming locust left, the canker-worm has eaten, and what the canker-worm left, the caterpillar has eaten.

5.verse: Awake, drunkards, and weep! Wail, all you drinkers of wine— on account of sweet wine, for it is denied to your mouth!

6.verse: For a nation has invaded my land. Vast—yes, without number! Its teeth are lion’s teeth, with jaw-teeth of a lioness.

7.verse: He has turned my vine to waste and my fig tree to splinters. He has stripped off all the bark and flung it down— its branches are left white.

8.verse: Wail like a virgin dressed in sackcloth for the husband of her youth!

9.verse: Grain offering and drink offering are cut off from the House of ADONAI. Kohanim—ministers of ADONAI—mourn.

10.verse: The field is ruined, the land grieves, for the grain has been devastated, new wine is dried up, oil languishes.

11.verse: Be ashamed, O ploughmen; wail, O vinedressers, over wheat and over barley, for the harvest of the field is lost.

12.verse: The vine withered, the fig tree wilted. Pomegranate, palm and apple tree —all trees of the field—are withered, for joy has withered away from the children of men.

13.verse: Gird yourselves and weep, kohanim! Howl, ministers of the altar! Come, lie in sackcloth all night, ministers of my God. For grain and drink offering are withheld from the House of your God.

14.verse: The Day is Near! - Consecrate a fast. Proclaim a solemn assembly. Gather elders and all living in the land to the House of ADONAI your God, and cry to ADONAI.

15.verse: Ah, the day! The day of ADONAI is near! As havoc from Shaddai it will come.

16.verse: Is food not cut off before our eyes— joy and gladness from God’s House?

17.verse: Seed has shriveled under the dirt clod. Storehouses are desolate, granaries are torn down, for the grain has withered.

18.verse: How the animals groan! The herds of cattle are perplexed, because they have no pasture. The flocks of sheep also suffer.

19.verse: To You, ADONAI, I cry! For fire has devoured the pastures of the wilderness, and flame has set ablaze all the trees of the field.

20.verse: Also beasts of the field pant toward You. For the water of wadis are dried up, and fire has devoured the pastures of the wilderness.

1.verse: Blow the shofar in Zion! Sound an alarm on My holy mountain! Let all living in the land tremble— for the day of ADONAI is coming— surely it is near!

2.verse: A day of darkness and gloominess, a day of clouds and thick darkness, as blackness spreads over the mountains. A great and mighty people— from antiquity there was never anything like it, nor after it ever again from generation to generation.

3.verse: A fire devours before them and behind them flame blazes up. Like the Garden of Eden is the land before them, and behind them a desolate wilderness. Nothing at all ever escapes them.

4.verse: Their appearance is like the appearance of horses— they gallop like war horses.

5.verse: Like the clatter of chariots, they leap on the tops of mountains, like crackling flame of fire devouring stubble, like a mighty horde in battle array.

6.verse: Before them peoples are in anguish. All faces become ashen gray.

7.verse: They run like mighty men. They climb a wall like men of war. They each march in line, never deviating from their ways.

8.verse: One does not crowd another. Each one marches on his own highway. They plunge through the weapons, never breaking off.

9.verse: They rush on the city, they run on the wall, they climb up into the houses, coming through the windows like a thief.

10.verse: Before them land quakes, heaven trembles, sun and moon become dark, stars withdraw their brightness.

11.verse: ADONAI utters His voice before His army. For His camp is very vast— for mighty is it that carries out His word. For great is the day of ADONAI— very terrifying! Who can endure it?

12.verse: Call for Teshuvah - “Yet even now” —it is a declaration of ADONAI— “turn to Me with all your heart, with fasting, weeping and lamenting.”

13.verse: Rend your heart, not your garments, and turn to ADONAI, your God. For He is gracious and compassionate, slow to anger, abundant in mercy, and relenting about the calamity due.

14.verse: Who knows? He may turn and relent, and may leave a blessing behind Him —so there may be a grain offering and a drink offering for ADONAI, your God.

15.verse: Blow the Shofar - Blow the shofar in Zion! Sanctify a fast; proclaim an assembly.

16.verse: Gather the people; sanctify the congregation; assemble the elders; gather the children, even those nursing at breasts. Let the bridegroom come out from his bedroom and the bride from her chamber.

17.verse: Between the porch and the altar let the kohanim, ministers of ADONAI, weep, and let them say: “Have pity, ADONAI, on Your people. Don’t make Your heritage a scorn, a byword among the nations. Why should the peoples say, ‘Where is their God?’”

18.verse: ADONAI will be zealous for His land, and have compassion on His people.

19.verse: ADONAI will answer and say to His people: “Behold, I will send you the grain, the new wine, and the fresh oil, and you will be satisfied with it. I will no longer make you a mockery among the nations.

20.verse: “But I will remove the northern invader far from you— yes, I will banish him to a dry and desolate land— his vanguard into the Eastern Sea and his rearguard into the Western Sea. His odor will go up— Yes, his stench will rise.” For He has done great things!

21.verse: Rain and Restoration - Do not fear, O land. Be glad! Rejoice! For ADONAI has done great things.

22.verse: Do not be afraid, beasts of the field, for the desert pastures have sprouted, for the tree bears its fruit. Fig tree and vine yield their strength.

23.verse: So be glad, children of Zion, and rejoice in ADONAI, your God. For He gives you the early rain for prosperity, Yes, He will bring down rain for you, the early and latter rain as before.

24.verse: The threshing floors will be full of grain and the vats will overflow with new wine and fresh oil.

25.verse: “I shall restore to you the years that the locust, the swarming locust, the canker-worm and the caterpillar have eaten— My great army that I sent among you.”

26.verse: “You will surely eat and be satisfied, and praise the Name of ADONAI your God, who has dealt wondrously with you. Never again will My people be shamed

27.verse: You will know that I am within Israel. Yes, I am ADONAI your God—there is no other— Never again will My people be shamed.”

1.verse: Promise of the Ruach ADONAI - “So it will be afterward, I will pour out My Ruach on all flesh: your sons and daughters will prophesy, your old men will dream dreams, your young men will see visions.

2.verse: “Also on the male and the female servants will I pour out My spirit in those days.

3.verse: I will show wonders in the heavens and on the earth— blood, fire and pillars of smoke.

4.verse: The sun will be turned into darkness and the moon into blood, before the great and awesome day of ADONAI comes.

5.verse: Then all who call on ADONAI’s Name will escape, for on Mount Zion and in Jerusalem there will be rescue, as ADONAI has said, among the survivors whom ADONAI is calling.”
